wp:category.wp:category_description: Pics and tidbits about this amazing country
All things Packers. I am biased, I am tactless, and I bleed green and gold
Annoy me and and I will post it. Really.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: My name is Trey King and I am an opinionated computer geek who thinks he is funnier than he really is.  My verbal proofreading skills are lacking at times and I thank my friends for their patience and flexibility. At the moment I am staying in beautiful Vicenza, Italy until November doing some computer work for the Dept. of Defense. I live in Atlanta but refuse to call it home, and in my spare time enjoy my '69 Harley, kegerator, and foosball table (usually in that order). I live and die with the Green Bay Packers, the subject of most of my rants. My wife pressed me to start this blog so that she would not have to listen to my incessant ramblings any more.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Jerry Jones had a great cameo in Entourage !

Hell hath no fury like a jilted Green Bay Packer fan. Does anyone else remember when they were in like 3rd grade, and you had a huge crush on Little Suzie but the only thing you could do was terrorize her? Make fun of her and chase her around the playground. I think I see some of that going on.

item.title: Stay Down, Bitch!!
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: I never thought I would be saying this, but I hate Brett Favre with a mad, undying passion. As all of my friends can attest, I would rather slam my hand in a car door than smile in the general direction of this modern-day Benedict Arnold. Fellow Packers fans know what I mean. Thankfully my temporary stay in Germany has shielded me from this years' annual Brett Favre Media Circus, and both myself and my dentist are quite thankful. Evidently my nightly gnashing of the teeth caused more damage than a mouth full of jawbreakers. Anyway, my buddy Joey texted me yesterday asking if I thought this time Favre was serious. Of course I had no idea what he was talking about (I don't get ESPN here), so with the gross curiosity of rubbernecking at a nine car pile-up I logged onto ESPN.com. Lo and behold, there it was. That bastard is at it again. Seriously, WTF? Does anyone think this is cute? Eccentric? Sweet Jewish God, The Media HAS to be running out of excuses for this guy, and as a true football fan I think I think I speak for us all when I say that we would rather hear about Albert Haynesworth and his latest failed physical or Jerry Jones' Entourage cameo. Packers fans worldwide (yes, we have that kind of fan base) can only chuckle at watching our NFC North rival Minnesota Vikings deal with the same crap that we were all too familiar with. Fifteen years ago I had a girlfriend (we will call her "Delilah") leave me for my buddy (he didn't hold that position for long), and the one thing I told him was that she was going to do it to him as well. Was I the bitter, jilted lover? Oh yeah. Did she add him to her mass of human emotional wreckage? Oh yeah. I couldn't help but feel the same way when Favre was traded away from the Packers. Yes, I realize that the Pack sent him packing (heh-heh, my wittiness is epic), but his lack of commitment to he future of the team signaled his emotional checking out of the relationship. Thankfully life has a way of rewarding the faithful. Delilah's roommate at that time is now my insanely hot wife, and the Packers are guided by one of the best quarterbacks in the NFL (Aaron Rodgers, I am forever your humble servant). God, I love a happy ending. Which brings me back to my point. My buddy Lance is a hard core Vikings supporter (I refuse to believe that they could have any "fans"), and I almost feel sorry for the guy. That is, when I am not mocking, jeering, and laughing hysterically about his "sudden" quarterback woes. I told him that Favre was going to do this to him as well, but he was blinded by the sexiness of it all. Brett Favre, you sick bastard. You dogged us out, man. This time I think I will keep my friend, even though his team had their uniforms designed by Barney the Dinosaur. Seriously Brett. How many season-ending, NFC Championship interceptions do you need to throw? It is blasphemy to think that you can hoist a trophy, named after our great Lombardi no less, outside of Green Bay. Every time I watch the video of you crying at the Packers press conference during your "retirement" announcement I laugh so hard I pee my pants a little. Stop it. Stop it now. Lance, I promise that you will laugh about this one day, just like I am laughing right now. Oops, i just peed my pants a little. Auf Wiedersehen!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Trey, I fear you may never recover from the emotional devastation you have experienced. It's pretty clear from this blog that you need professional help. I don't think therapy is the answer, more drastic measures are in order. Lithium, Prozac, Wellbutrin are all good starts or maybe the answer is hypnotherapy. Germany has many good clinics you can look into. As for the state of the Vikings; I said it last year: they are a good quarterback away from a Super Bowl. I was almost proved right. As painful as that loss was, it was all worth it to see the ex-hero of Green Bay kick the shit out of the Packers wearing Purple and Gold.
Easy Big Boy, Easy!! You are going to bust something ! Dad

item.title: Favre's knees
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: NEW ORLEANS - JANUARY 24: Brett Favre #4 of the Minnesota Vikings reacts after taking a hard hit in the second half against the New Orleans Saints during the NFC Championship Game at the Louisiana Superdome on January 24, 2010 in New Orleans, Louisiana. (Photo by Jed Jacobsohn/Getty Images) Original Filename: GYI0059395743.jpg

item.title: 95653900MH104_NFC_Champions
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: NEW ORLEANS - JANUARY 24: Brett Favre #4 of the Minnesota Vikings reacts after taking a hard hit in the second half against the New Orleans Saints during the NFC Championship Game at the Louisiana Superdome on January 24, 2010 in New Orleans, Louisiana. (Photo by Jed Jacobsohn/Getty Images) Original Filename: GYI0059395743.jpg

item.title: Trey vs. The Football Gods - Round 1
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: What have I done. All the emotion, conviction, and passion that was conjured during during my last posting has awoken, and angered, the totem spirits that weave and maintain the very fabric of that which we hold most dear. I am, of course, referring to The Football Gods. With the reckless abandon of a slimmer, yet equally audacious Rush Limbaugh (minus the pharmaceutical addiction), I professed what I KNEW to be true, and now the sports world must suffer. How could I have been so stupid. Trey vs. The Football Gods - Round 1 Yesterday morning I was enjoying my morning coffee, eating my brie (I cant find any cocoa puffs), when I opened that day's copy of the "Stars and Stripes", a small newspaper put out by the U.S. Military. Great read, really. And looky what I found in the NFL section. Actually, the page above WAS the NFL section. Son of a bitch. I nearly choked on my baguette (how do you say "Heimlich maneuver" in German?) when confronted with a half-page pic of the Anti-Christ himself. See that headline? "Not so fast". Not so fast???? Really??? Did anyone think that Brett Favre, who jumps from "retired" to "unretired" with the frequency of a cheap ham radio (you are the man, Mr. Aykroyd), would actually honor his word?? No wonder that bastard audibles all the time; he has already changed his decision 3 times about the play from the time leaves the huddle to the time he reaches the line of scrimmage! Oh, and don't give me that "he's reading the defense" bull crap. HE'S FROM MISSISSIPPI. Who can read in Mississippi??? After pouring over the article for better than an hour, a few things stood out. 1) Even Bus Cook (Favre's Agent) is tired of this third-rate carnival act. 2) Roger Goodell (NFL Commissioner) is quoted saying "Brett Favre is great for our game". Roger, you clearly suffer from "rectal - cranial inversion", and I advise you to seek medical attention immediately. Good for ratings (everyone loves a tragedy), good for your wallet, BAD for the game. This is an embarrassment for all those involved; get control. 3) Rogelio V. Solis (the photographer credited with the pic) should have been looking through a rifle scope instead of a camera lens. You had the shot, dude. Take it... Just my opinion. I could go on and on about this (just ask my buddy Skip), but I digress! There were bigger forces at that work that morning, and during my third cup of coffee I was struck by an epiphany: Brett Favre was just a tool. I mean, I have been calling him a "tool" for a couple of years now, but now he really was just a tool! An instrument of the Football Gods, meant to punish me for my insolence. But they weren't just punishing me, they were punishing every football fan around the globe, and it was all my fault. With God as my witness, I will make this right. To Be Continued...

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hi Trey, I will read this out loud to Andy since he will not find it in the internet. (Not entirely his fault, since we don't have internet at home yet, but i digress.)
I was just reading this: http://www.slate.com/id/2262885/ yesterday and decided I needed to find your blog. Keep it up, since I need something besides excel spreadsheets and databases to look at during the day.
Trey, Please remember you studly dad is from Mississippi and proud of it. Maybe you are kin to Bret and don't know it.?????????

Trey, I don't think you have thought Brett Favre's "retirement" through. As a friend I feel it is my duty to let you in on the Football God's next cruel joke. It is pretty well know that the media can't get enough Brett Favre and Brett Favre can't get enough of the media. So this year, next year, or five years from now when the inevitable does happen: (brace yourself) Brett Favre will become an NFL analyst. Many years of the Anti-Christ himself, dissecting and Monday Morning Quarterbacking another poor performance by Aaron Rogers VS the Vikings (Oh, the cruel cruel irony). I don't know what you have done to anger the Gods in this manner, but at least it will give you plenty of fodder for your ramblings.

I will commit Japanese ritualistic suicide if I have to watch him commentate. That idiot would contradict himself 3 times in the same sentence. Don't wish that painful fate on the football world... Let him go to home to Missi-wherever and race lawnmowers or whatever completely self absorbed assholes do.

item.title: Brett Favre Is The Kraken
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: 故曰：知彼知己，百戰不殆；不知彼而知己.  (So it is said that if you know your enemies and know yourself, you can win a hundred battles without a single loss.) - Sun Tzu, The Art Of War The Football Gods had spat at me, and Brett Favre was the phlegm... As I was leafing through the third chapter of Sun Tzu's 2500 year old military masterpiece, I came across a couple of things that caused me to reexamine my approach to the recent and grisly turn of events. The first is the importance of alliances. According to Sun Tzu, your alliances can be more valuable than the strength of your own army. So, who's coming with me? Who's coming with me? If you love football, you can no longer say that you love Brett Favre IN football (sorry Andy) because the two are oil and water. Only a fan of reality TV (shout out to my boys "The Situation" and Pauly D! Jersey Shore fist pumping! Snooki, you are TOO fine girl. keep tanning.) could possibly find this self serving, media suckling narcissist an asset to the sport. Think it over. The second came while reading the last verse of the chapter, which I quoted above. Or as Zack De La Rocha so eloquently put it, "know your enemy". Not simply knowing who your enemy is, but also know what your enemy is. So this morning I am staring at a pic of "him", trying to keep my breakfast down, and I was confronted by a chilling truth. Brett Favre isn't the monster I have portrayed his as over the last two seasons. You heard me. Brett Favre is NOT the monster I have portrayed him as over the the last two seasons. He is so much worse. Brett Favre is the Kraken! Don't believe me? Look at the pics! The empty eyes, the complete lack of emotion (those aren't real tears, drama queen), their heads are even at the same angle! Come on, it's the same guy!! Favre was released by the Football Gods last year at this very time to destroy the season for fans around the globe (which he did with incredible precision), and now he has surfaced again. Oh hell no. Not on my watch. For those of you still in doubt, allow me to illustrate. Manning loses a Super Bowl? The Cowboys WIN a playoff game?? Favre ties for the league lead (with our own Aaron Rodgers, off course) in fewest interceptions? ARE YOU KIDDING ME???? Favre, who closes his eyes and throws it as hard as he can? Favre, who threw SIX interceptions IN ONE GAME against the Rams in the 2001 postseason (three being returned for touchdowns). BTW, I was watching some sideline clips of that game a while back and at one point when Favre came to the sideline I could actually hear Mike Sherman (Green Bay coach at that time) say "Uh, Brett, we're wearing white today". Honest. But I digress! Last season was crap, and anybody with an I.Q. larger than their shoe size (let's go ahead and weed out those Minnesota supporters) can see that. Nobody with a true love for football wants a repeat of last season, plain and simple. So now that we know what Favre really is, how do we kill it? I don't know, but if those Saturday cartoons taught me anything, it's that knowing is half the battle (thanks, Duke). Perhaps holding John Madden's head up for Favre to see, turning him into a brain dead, monosyllabic beast? Maybe. But it needs to be done, and soon. To Be Continued... P.S. - I don't watch Jersey Shore; I just needed to put something in the post that would keep my wife's attention. She tends to glaze over when I start the whole "Favre is the devil" rant.

item.title: Brett Favre Is The Kraken!
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: 故曰：知彼知己，百戰不殆；不知彼而知己.  (So it is said that if you know your enemies and know yourself, you can win a hundred battles without a single loss.) - Sun Tzu, The Art Of War The Football Gods had spat at me, and Brett Favre was the phlegm... wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Trey, Your Mom and I are worried! Shake loose of this hold he has on you. You are the only one suffering. certainly not Mr. Brett. "He who angers you controls you" Love You, Dad
You don't watch Jersey Shore my ass. If anyone here is a dramatic person, Trey, its you.
You are bleeding like a can of tomatoes.
Albert Haynesworth is the Ass Kracken

item.title: Making Adjustments...
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: Hello everyone! As some of you know, I have been transferred from Germany to Italy. Just outside Venice, to be exact, and am still making the "little adjustments". Really didn't want to leave Germany. The food was fantastic (couldn't find any boiled pig stomach, Skip. Sorry...), the beer was incomparable, and the people were very endearing. I will post links to a flikr account shortly so everyone can view the gorgeous German countryside. Speaking of little adjustments, they sure do have oddly short sinks here. Check out the pic! Brushing my teeth on my knees was a little uncomfortable at first, but "when in Rome", right? I mean, Venice. The nozzle angle does make it easier to drink from the faucet though, so that's a plus. This one will be short, I just wanted to post something after going a week with no internet. Ciao!!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I always thought those things were just the right height for me.
Trey, make sure you don't confuse your "sink" for the toilet, the maids hate that.

Trey…you are so right…what is it with those things? But then again I too found comfort in the “short sinks”. One night, many-many years ago in Rome, I had a wonderful evening of sampling the local wines. Later that night I required a drink of water to eliminate my grape induced dryness. I found it much easier to crawl into the bathroom on my hands and knees and partake from the “short sink” then trying to stand up. And waking up hour later with one’s head in the “short sink” sound much better than “in the toilet”. Thanks
Ummm.... are you sure that isn't a bidet?
LJ! of course i know it's a bidet. the fun is imagining me with my mouth to the faucet. play along, dammit!
eewwwww. oh yeah, i promptly trashed the cup, toothbrush, and scope after staging the pic!

item.title: School Days...
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: For the longest time I had no idea what kind of work I would be doing here in Europe. Everyone was being very vague when describing the job, which kind of intrigued me a bit. No more modding Xbox consoles for me! I am going to do some real work! Captain Hefling: "What about that Red Chinese radio chatter?" Trey: "It's done. Here you go." Captain Hefling: "Done? That was a static filled, triple scrambled, microwave transmission between two soldiers talking in Mandarin Chinese." Trey: "Well, the Chinese were only using a polyphoneticly grouped twenty square digit key, transposed from booster verdonic form with multiple nulls. I broke it with this." Captain Hefling: "A Drogen's Decoder Wheel? They put these into cereal boxes for kids!" Trey: "Yeah, I found it in a box of, uh... Lucky Charms." Yeah well, back in reality I have finally settled into my position as the network administrator for the high school on base. Yep, here I was, ready to save the world (you know that they hand-picked me for the job, right?), when they really needed me to make sure that Lydia Turner was able to email her PTA announcements to the parents (you cant have a check next to the proxy server option, Lydia. We have gone over this...). But my computer prowess will not be ignored! I make Microsoft Excel load up FAST! "Trey, what did you do? Is my computer supposed to makes those sounds?" Lydia! Don't make me tell you again! If it ain't smokin', it ain't brokin! Damn! Quit ridin' me or I'll reroute your emails to Afghanistan. Anyway, I was able to order some supplies for my office and wanted to tell you about a couple of nice additions that I am very excited about. Not just the clicky pens or the endless legal pads, but the motivational posters! That's right, thought provokers like "Ambition; Aspire to climb as high as you can dream", or "Courage is resistance to fear, the mastery of fear - not the absence of fear". You got it Skipper, that was Mark Twain. You would get a gold star if I had remembered to order those. Dammit. Every faculty member knows that the motivational poster is THE "make or break" statement in every office, so after going through the catalog for nearly an hour, I settled on the two below. They should be in next week. I hope you find them inspirational! Ciao!

item.title: An Open Letter Of Apology
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: I will make this short and sweet, as my heart weighs heavy with the anger and frustration that I have directed towards arguably the greatest quarterback in football history. I, Trey King, am ready to extend an olive branch to Brett Favre and bring to an end this terrible unidirectional feud that has placed a black mark on the last two football seasons. True, I recently said that I wouldn't piss on Brett Favre if he were on fire. But I didn't mean it. Yeah, I spray painted "DIE" across my Favre jersey in bright red and displayed it proudly in my garage. I was just confused... And how many times did I tell the joke "Judas Iscariot, Benedict Arnold, and Brett Favre walk in to a bar"? That one was always a crowd pleaser. But I think the image below is a strong representation of how we Green Bay Packer fans truly feel in our heart of hearts, and I wanted to share it with the rest of the world.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Trey, I think you are confused... didn't you draft Brett Favre at the top of the 2nd round in for your fantasy football team?
I drafted him just so that I could bench him for the season. It is a control thing... This is fantasy football, and in my fantasy that piece of trash is not on the field.

Trey. Keep it coming Farve is done my young friend. Enjoy
Knapper

item.title: Nurse?... Nurse!!!
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: I admit it. I committed THE cardinal sin of blogging. Regardless of how busy you are, don't let your blog die. Blogging takes more time than I had originally anticipated, but then again, it is much more rewarding as well. The amount of laughing that I do while writing these posts is therapeutic in so many ways. Then point is that I didn't want to spend my time inside on a computer when I should be outside enjoying Italian life. Well, now that I am back in the states (sniff-sniff), it is my duty, my responsibility, to continue to shine my written light of truth on those who yearn for total football consciousness. I will post something mid week for those in need of nourishment; my mortal enemy has uttered the "R" word (retirement) again...

item.title: Thank You For NOT Retiring, Brett Favre
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: This is my third attempt at writing this post, with each successive version being a little more calm, and a little less vulgar. The merciless thrashing of the Vikings by the Packers this past Sunday created both emotional frenzy and peace for this self-proclaimed mortal enemy of the one they call Favre. This was never intended to be an anti-Favre blog, though it seems to have turned into one. True, I am EXTREMELY anti-Favre, but I would like to think that I have more to say than just "F@#k Favre" (which I DO say; a lot, actually. that's just not ALL I have to say). His usual antics made him an easy target, and like a shark that smells a drop of blood from a quarter mile away, I moved in for the easy kill. Honestly, one week hasn't gone by this season without some sort of drama from this guy. It's either an "injury", or an issue with the coaching staff, or this texting saga (really dude? really???), or the perennial "will he/won't he" media fire that is as much a part of August football as training camp and preseason games. After this last game my mother told me that "I was the last doughnut on the plate and the jelly was running out" Is  she senile? Yes. Does she have a point? Maybe, and that is the scariest part of it. It was at that point that I realized that my hatred of Brett Favre had made my jelly run out. He who laughs last, laughs best. Now that Packers have not only beaten, but humiliated Brett Favre in his last attempt to recapture his glory days, I am more at peace than I would have expected. The other day the unthinkable occurred to me; I am really glad that Favre did not retire before the season as I had so desperately hoped he would. My rage had made me short sighted, and it became clear that had Favre retired as I had hoped, I would have missed out on so much this season. Favre vs. the interception gremlins (don't feed them after midnight, Brett!), the Vikings vs. Randy Moss (waiving one of the most feared receivers in football after 3 games guys? Brad Childress must have picked up that "waffling" maneuver from "head coach" Brett Favre), and the overall meltdown of the entire Minnesota organization. This has been a very satisfying year to be a Packers fan. Thank you Brett Favre for NOT retiring. This will be my last "F@#k Favre" posting. This is not to say that I will not "poke a stick at the dead squirrel on the side of the road", but I will try not to focus all my energies on him. After all, he is just a shell of the 3-time MVP I worshiped so long ago. The painted-over jersey in my garage stay though.

item.title: I'm your huckleberry! (or an open plea for mercy to Foundry Cycles)
item.dc:creator: treysramblings
item.content:encoded: Those of you who have ridden with me over the last year are well aware of my recent obsession for single speeding. It honestly has made me a better rider and a much better climber (although I still enjoy cussing my way to the top). This past winter (if you can call 50 degrees in north Georgia "winter") I had the pleasure of putting together a 2006 Salsa Juan Solo and absolutely love it. A single speed with a Star Wars influence? ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? You had me at "A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away"! Her specs are not anything to get excited over and I still maintain that I chose v-brakes because  of weight and not because of budget (*cough* lies!). But the facts are that she rolls straight, has a respectable look to her, and most importantly, she is all I have. Josh Boggs and the other guys at Outspokin Bikes (Woodstock, GA) must cringe when I walk through the door. The old and decrepit frames that I have tried to resurrect over the past two years have been an embarrassment to all those involved. Seriously, those guys don't get paid enough to deal with me. They made fun of my mid-90's Cannondale F1000 for it's cantilever brakes and hideous bar ends (what ever happened to bar ends, anyway?) and told me to keep the discarded parts in case I wanted to restore it to "vintage". That's just mean, guys... Regardless, stripping down that bike and creating a 21 lb. nimble, "climbs like a goat" single speed was the best thing I could have ever done. It introduced me to the world of those consumed by two wheels and dirt, and now I am a man obsessed. A couple of weeks ago Josh told me that Outspokin was going to be one of only a handful of shops carrying a new brand and that I should come by and check out an "open house" that they were putting on. I had never heard of Foundry Cycles, but hell, I wander around their showroom daydreaming all the time, so free pizza and beer sealed the deal (don't judge me!). All 3 bikes were gorgeous, but it was their simplicity and elegance that really grabbed me. I was able to chat a bit with Jason Grant (the owner of Foundry) and we agreed that if Batman rode a mountain bike, it would most definitely be their stealthy 29" Router. Or better yet, Darth Vader! Darth Vader: "I've been waiting for you, Trey. We meet again, at last. The circle is now complete. When I left you, I was but the learner; now I am the master." Trey: "Only a master of gears, Darth." (Lightsabers clash) A few hours later I get back to my house, check out their website, and discover their "Tradesman" program, which brings me to my next point. I'm your huckleberry!!! Oh merciful representatives of Foundry Cycles, hear my prayer! I don't just want, I NEED the Router. My single speed has been a two edged sword in that while it has forced me to hyperfocus on fundamental principles (find the best line, and MOMENTUM!!!), it has been adversely affecting my social life and I have slipped into what can only be called "derailleur depression". Yeah, you heard me. I am not included when my friends go to the North GA mountains to ride for the day, or when they ride Blanket's Creek for a couple of hours and then go to Rope Mill. Don't get me wrong, the force is strong with this one, but I am not a Jedi yet. I have about ten miles in the tank when riding at on intermediate/advanced trails, and just cant keep up with all of my geared companions. If they are planning on riding 30-40 miles over the course of an afternoon, they don't even tell me they are going. Grant me the opportunity to be your Tradesman for the Southeast so that I may rejoin the geared community and experience another side of cycling on the bike of my dreams. Help me, Foundry Cycles; you're my only hope.
